pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:0.5: 37. The training rule on eating at the wrong time
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.2: At that time in Rājagaha there was a hilltop fair,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.3: and the monks from the group of seventeen went to see it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.4: When people saw the monks, they bathed them, anointed them, fed them staples, and gave them non-staple food.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.5: The monks brought that food back to the monastery. And they said to the monks from the group of six,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.7: “But where did you get this food?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.9: “So are you eating at the wrong time?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.11: The monks from the group of six complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.12: “How can those monks from the group of seventeen eat at the wrong time?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.14: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.15: “How can those monks from the group of seventeen eat at the wrong time?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.16: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.19: “… Foolish men, how can you eat at the wrong time?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.20: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.21: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.22.1: ‘If a monk eats staple or non-staple food at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.6: when the middle of the day has passed, until dawn.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.8: apart from the five staple foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “non-staple food”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.10: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.11: If he receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.12: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.1: If it is the wrong time, and he perceives it as such, and he eats staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.2: If it is the wrong time, but he is unsure of it, and he eats staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.3: If it is the wrong time, but he perceives it as the right time, and he eats staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.4: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.5: For every mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.6: If it is the right time, but he perceives it as the wrong time, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.7: If it is the right time, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.8: If it is the right time, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.2: if, when there is a reason, he uses post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.4: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.5: The seventh rule, the training rule on eating at the wrong time, is finished.
